education.institution: University of Washington School of Law

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science

work_habits.preferred_working_hours: Early bird (07:00‑12:00) with flexible afternoon slots

communication_style.preference: Async for routine updates, sync for negotiations or crisis
communication_style.response_time_expectation: Within 2‑4 business hours for async, immediate for sync calls

work_habits.meeting_preferences: Minimizes meetings; prefers 30‑minute standing meetings with clear agenda; only attends face‑to‑face when contract sign‑off required
work_habits.work_environment: Hybrid (3 days remote, 2 days in Seattle office)
work_habits.focus_time_requirements: At least 4 uninterrupted hours per day for deep legal analysis

personality.decision_making_approach: Data‑driven, consults key stakeholders but makes final call after risk assessment
personality.risk_tolerance: Moderate – comfortable with calculated legal risk, avoids exposure to regulatory penalties
personality.collaboration_style: Strategic partner; provides guidance but expects deliverables on schedule
personality.stress_management_approach: Scheduled short walks, mindfulness apps, and delegating tactical tasks to junior counsel
personality.conflict_resolution_style: Direct yet diplomatic; uses facts and precedent to defuse tension

tools_proficiency: Contract lifecycle management (CLM) platforms – Ironclad, Agiloft

availability.timezone_and_working_hours: Pacific Time, typically 07:00‑17:30 with 1‑hour lunch break
availability.other_commitments: Quarterly board advisory role for a nonprofit tech incubator (≈4 hrs/month)
availability.travel_flexibility: Up to 20% travel (≈1‑2 weeks per quarter) for contract sign‑offs and M&A due diligence

personal_factors.caregiving_responsibilities: Occasional weekend school events; no regular elder‑care duties
personal_factors.commute_situation: 15‑minute drive to office; prefers driving to avoid public‑transit delays
personal_factors.health_considerations: Mild hypertension managed with medication and regular exercise; avoids excessive overtime
personal_factors.career_motivation: Desire to shape corporate governance in emerging tech, mentor next‑gen counsel, and eventually transition to Chief Legal Officer role

collaboration.meeting_frequency_preference: Bi‑weekly strategic syncs; ad‑hoc as needed for urgent matters
collaboration.feedback_style: Direct with data‑backed examples; follows up with written summary
collaboration.knowledge_sharing_habits: Runs monthly ‘Legal Briefings’ for product teams; contributes to internal wiki

risk_factors.potential_bottlenecks: Heavy reliance on his sign‑off for high‑value contracts can create delays if he is unavailable
risk_factors.backup_person_needed: Senior Associate Counsel – Maya Patel (3‑year tenure) can act as interim sign‑off for routine agreements
